text:
Hello,

I've updated gcc to 4.1.1 and glibc to 2.5 then tried to recompile apache
2.0.58 or 2.0.59 without success! Compilation worked before update to gcc
4.1.1 and glibc 2.5, here a part of the error.

/usr/src/pc/BUILD/httpd-2.0.58/srclib/apr/libtool --silent --mode=link gcc
 -pthread  -Os -march=i686 -fomit-frame-pointer  -DLINUX=2 -D_REENTRANT
-D_GNU_SOURCE -DAP_HAVE_DESIGNATED_INITIALIZER  
-I/usr/src/pc/BUILD/httpd-2.0.58/srclib/apr/include
-I/usr/src/pc/BUILD/httpd-2.0.58/srclib/apr-util/include -I.
-I/usr/src/pc/BUILD/httpd-2.0.58/os/
-I/usr/src/pc/BUILD/httpd-2.0.58/server/mpm/
-I/usr/src/pc/BUILD/httpd-2.0.58/modules/http
-I/usr/src/pc/BUILD/httpd-2.0.58/modules/filters
-I/usr/src/pc/BUILD/httpd-2.0.58/modules/proxy
-I/usr/src/pc/BUILD/httpd-2.0.58/include
-I/usr/src/pc/BUILD/httpd-2.0.58/modules/generators     -o libpcre.la 
maketables.lo get.lo study.lo pcre.lo pcreposix.lo
make[3]: Leaving directory `/usr/src/pc/BUILD/httpd-2.0.58/srclib/pcre'
make[2]: Leaving directory `/usr/src/pc/BUILD/httpd-2.0.58/srclib/pcre'
make[1]: Leaving directory `/usr/src/pc/BUILD/httpd-2.0.58/srclib'
Making all in os
make[1]: Entering directory `/usr/src/pc/BUILD/httpd-2.0.58/os'
make[1]: Leaving directory `/usr/src/pc/BUILD/httpd-2.0.58/os'
Making all in server
make[1]: Entering directory `/usr/src/pc/BUILD/httpd-2.0.58/server'
Making all in mpm
make[2]: Entering directory `/usr/src/pc/BUILD/httpd-2.0.58/server/mpm'
make[2]: *** No rule to make target `all'.  Stop.
make[2]: Leaving directory `/usr/src/pc/BUILD/httpd-2.0.58/server/mpm'
make[1]: *** [all-recursive] Error 1
make[1]: Leaving directory `/usr/src/pc/BUILD/httpd-2.0.58/server'
make: *** [all-recursive] Error 1
error: Bad exit status from /var/tmp/rpm-tmp.3598 (%build)

Gerhard,
creator: gmourani@openna.com
jorton@redhat.com
text:
Are you building from scratch?  Is this reproducible?  Does this work if you
don't force CFLAGS to "-Os"?
